headline: Ask HN: Did W3C Spec, Divergence Rather Convergence and Interoperability?
description:
https://www.theregister.com/2022/07/01/w3c_overrules_objections/?td=rt-3a

"The DID architectural approach appears to encourage divergence rather than convergence & interoperability," wrote Tantek Çelik, web standards lead at Mozilla, in a mailing list post last year. "The presence of 50+ entries in the registry, without any actual interoperability, seems to imply that there are greater incentives to introduce a new method, than to attempt to interoperate with any one of a number of growing existing methods."
headline_zh-Hans: Ask HN: W3C规范，是分歧，还是融合和互操作性？
headline_zh-Hant: Ask HN: W3C規範，是分歧，還是融合和互操作性？
description_zh-Hans:
https://www.theregister.com/2022/07/01/w3c_overrules_objections/?td=rt-3a

"DID架构方法似乎鼓励分歧，而不是融合和互操作性，"Mozilla的网络标准负责人Tantek Çelik在去年的邮件列表中写道。"注册表中存在50多个条目，而没有任何实际的互操作性，似乎意味着有更大的动力来引入新方法，而不是试图与许多不断增长的现有方法中的任何一个互操作。
description_zh-Hant:
https://www.theregister.com/2022/07/01/w3c_overrules_objections/?td=rt-3a

"DID架構方法似乎鼓勵分歧，而不是融合和互操作性，"Mozilla的網絡標準負責人Tantek Çelik在去年的郵件列表中寫道。"註冊表中存在50多個條目，而沒有任何實際的互操作性，似乎意味著有更大的動力來引入新方法，而不是試圖與許多不斷增長的現有方法中的任何一個互操作。
